titles: Oxford this 11 of June 1644. Whereas by an order bearing date the 8th of this instant Iune, it was ordered, that all inhabitants and persons resident within this city, should at their perils within seven days after the date thereof, provide and lay in for their families three moneths provision of corne and other victuals ...
author: Oxford (England). Council.
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Emergency food supply --  Law and legislation --  England --  Oxford --  Sources.
